oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Ancestry booklet of the Hobbs-Elrod family
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Included in this booklet is a photo of Dr. William Hobbs, from Ragelsville, Ind. who joined the Union Army in Oct. 1862. His brother Wilson Hobbs was also in Union army. William Hobbs served as hospital steward and later as assistant surgeon in the; 85th Ind. Inf. Regt., USA. Wilson Hobbs served as surgeon in the 85th Ind. Inf. Regt., USA. The 85th Indiana was captured by Earl Van Dorn at Thompson's Station. After being exchanged they fought in the Altanta Campaign and through the Carolinas.
